item.title: Venessa add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Everyone is in favor of free speech. Hardly a day passes without its being extolled, but some people's idea of it is that they are free to say what they like, but if anyone else says anything back, that is an outrage." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Henry Steele Commager
item.description: "The fact is that censorship always defeats its own purpose, for it creates, in the end, the kind of society that is incapable of exercising real discretion." -- Henry Steele Commager

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Lillian Hellman
item.description: "I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions." -- Lillian Hellman

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Holbrook Jackson
item.description: "Fear of corrupting the mind of the younger generation is the loftiest form of cowardice." -- Holbrook Jackson

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Robert H. Jackson
item.description: "Civil government cannot let any group ride roughshod over others simply because their consciences tell them to do so." -- Robert H. Jackson

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Lyndon Baines Johnson
item.description: "Books and ideas are the most effective weapons against intolerance and ignorance." -- Lyndon Baines Johnson

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Juvenal
item.description: "Quis custodiet ipsos custodes? - Who will watch the watchers?" -- Juvenal

item.title: Venessa add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"We are not afraid to entrust the American people with unpleasant facts, foreign ideas, alien philosophies, and competitive values. For a nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people."
[<i>Remarks on the 20th Anniversary of the Voice of America</i>; Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, February 26, 1962]" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Golda Meir
item.description: "One cannot and must not try to erase the past merely because it does not fit the present." -- Golda Meir

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Harry S. Truman
item.description:
"Once a government is committed to the principle of silencing the voice of opposition, it has only one way to go, and that is down the path of increasingly repressive measures, until it becomes a source of terror to all its citizens and creates a country where everyone lives in fear."
[<i>Special Message to the Congress on the Internal Security of the United States</i>, August 8, 1950]" -- Harry S. Truman

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "All these people talk so eloquently about getting back to good old-fashioned values. Well, as an old poop I can remember back to when we had those old-fashioned values, and I say let's get back to the good old-fashioned First Amendment of the good old-fashioned Constitution of the United States -- and to hell with the censors! Give me knowledge or give me death!" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Venessa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde
